intro: Siphocampylus crenatifolius, commonly known as the crested siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
